meanings.definition: Having a smooth, glossy finish resembling satin.
meanings.sent1: The new car had a satinier paint job than the old one.
meanings.sent2: Her satinier dress shimmered under the lights.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur looked satinier than a luxurious pillow.
meanings.sent4: The lake reflected the moonlight, creating a satinier surface.
meanings.sent5: The satinier fabric felt cool against her skin.

meanings.definition: To make something smoother and glossier, like satin.
meanings.sent1: She used a special polish to satinier the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: The tailor worked hard to satinier the wedding gown.
meanings.sent3: He tried to satinier the floor with banana peels, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes satiniered the canvas with each stroke.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully satiniered the sauce to perfection.

meanings.definition: More smooth and glossy than something else.
meanings.sent1: The satinier silk scarf stood out among the others.
meanings.sent2: His shoes were satinier than anyone else's at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so satinier that it almost looked fake.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was satinier than the brightest star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The polished marble floor was the satinier of all.
